references.paper_title: Video pretraining (vpt): Learning to act by watching unlabeled online videos.
references.reason: This paper provides the foundational model for action prediction which SBD relies on for discovering skill boundaries and is heavily used in Stage I and II in SBD.

references.paper_title: Groot: Learning to follow instructions by watching gameplay videos.
references.reason: This paper introduces the video-conditioned policy (GROOT) which is used in Stage III of the SBD pipeline to master atomic skills, making it crucial for performance comparisons and demonstrating SBD's benefits.

references.paper_title: Steve-1: A generative model for text-to-behavior in minecraft.
references.reason: This paper introduces the language-conditioned policy (STEVE-1) which is also used in Stage III of the SBD pipeline, similar to GROOT, and serves a significant role in evaluating the algorithm's ability to improve various skill benchmarks.

references.paper_title: Transformer-xl: Attentive language models beyond a fixed-length context.
references.reason: This paper lays the groundwork for using Transformer-XL architecture in the foundational model, which is a key component in capturing temporal dependencies for action prediction within SBD.
This paper introduces Event Segmentation Theory (EST) that is the theoretical inspiration for the SBD algorithm to automatically segment skills in videos.
